At Intrado, we offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes what you’d expect (medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid time off, a 401(k) retirement plan with company match and flexible spending accounts), and several that go above and beyond – tuition reimbursement, paid parental leave, access to a robust library of personal and professional training resources, employee discounts, critical illness, hospital indemnity and pet insurances, identity protection and more! Apply today to join us in work worth doing!

Starting salary for this position is expected between $107,000 and $130,000 and will be commensurate with experience.

About Us

Intrado is dedicated to saving lives and protecting communities, helping them prepare for, respond to, and recover from critical events. Our cutting-edge SaaS company is at the forefront of transforming the 911 emergency response continuum with next generation data-driven software. Intrado’s solutions allow enterprises, call takers, dispatchers, and first responders to make more informed decisions, respond quickly and safely, and ultimately serve their communities better.

Our Company has sales and/or operations in the United States, Canada and Europe and is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Veterans/Disabled and Other Protected Categories. Our Company welcomes and encourages applications of individuals with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Intrado maintains a Drug Free Workplace.

title: Associate Director, Biostatistics
description:
Position Summary

The Associate Director, Biostatistics will oversee and support the biostatistics activities across a single clinical program and provides biostatistics leadership and expertise to project and study teams (including CROs/vendors).

This position will be remote and will need to have a periodic onsite presence at the Parsippany, NJ office. The Associate Director will report to the Senior Director, Biostatistics.

Primary Responsibilities

Provides leadership for biostatistics function which supports all aspects of the oncology programs that will be required to enable optimal study design, analysis and reporting;Strong technical, scientific and strategic drug development expertise as part of the Oncology Technical Review Committee, the main governance committee for oncology programs;Develops processes and standards that are in accordance with GCP and ICH guidelines to enable efficient and consistent biostatistics activities;Supervises CRO outputs and biostatistics contractors;Acts as primary liaison for statistical issues and programming specifications between medical and clinical operations personnel, CROs, and Biometrics;Contributes to protocol development by choosing an appropriate study design and statistical methodology, defining endpoints, calculating necessary sample size, and writing statistical sections of the protocol;Develops or reviews statistical analysis plans;Leads the clinical study report (CSR) development process, including mapping out timelines, performing statistical analyses, preparing sections of the report, and reviewing the report;Establishes and negotiates accurate timelines with internal and external team members for completion of study-related biostatistical activities;Represents biostatistics on project teams;A flexible and thoughtful mindset about new statistical approaches and be able to communicate effectively with medical, clinical, and programming personnel;Generates or reviews and approve tables, listings, and graphs (TLGs) in collaboration with statistical programmers to ensure accurate and appropriate analyses and results;Conducts and participates in validation and quality control of project deliverables as necessary;Collaborates with internal and external resources (CRO's) to ensure consistency of methods, interpretation, and approach;Performs statistical analyses and prepare corresponding sections of the research report, with responsibility for review of entire research report. 

Experience & Competencies

PhD in Statistics/Biostatistics with at least 5 years of experience in biotech/pharma industry as a biostatistician, preferably 7 or more years of progressive experience in clinical trials in a biostatistician role;Oncology drug development experience is required;Later stage clinical trials, NDA/BLA submissions, and experiences with FDA and ex-US regulatory authorities are highly desired;Mastery of statistical theory, including standard experimental design and analysis methods;Prior experience managing and interacting with CROs;Strong implementation skills; must be comfortable with SAS and/or R programming;Familiar with ICH and other regulatory requirements related to biostatistical activities;Proven leadership capabilities, including an ability to appropriately prioritize and resource to drive for results, to deploy sound judgment in complex situations, to maintain a positive attitude in face of adversity, and to effectively influence and work with others at multiple levels within the organization;Excellent written and oral communication as well as strong interpersonal communication skills;Proven track record of commitment to the success of others and total ownership and accountability of personal and functional performance. 

Benefit Statement:

All regular-status, full-time employees of Geron are eligible to participate in the Company’s comprehensive benefit program, pursuant to plan terms and conditions. Plan choices include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, disability insurance, a 401(k)-retirement savings plan, and an employee stock purchase plan. Geron also provides regular-status, full-time employees with a generous time off program that includes vacation, sick, holiday, and paid leave for certain life events.

title: Information Technology Specialist - Data Operations
description:
Come be a part of something big! Smart Minds, Cool Jobs and Awesome Rewards! Fueled by innovation, talent and ambition, the Air Force Civilian Service (AFCS) is seeking civilian professionals prepared to deploy war-winning capabilities for the United States Air Force.

This position serves as a Data Operations Specialist/Data Analyst, responsible for creating, integrating, and maintaining a robust data management environment. The role involves establishing and enforcing data quality standards, and managing a cloud-enabled, secured reporting and analytics capability. The Candidate will also be responsible for representing the organization at conferences and meetings, leading special IT projects, and staying up-to-date with rapidly changing technology. The ultimate goal is to establish a “single source of truth” regarding HR-related data for Total Force Airmen, providing secure, visible, accessible, understandable, trusted, and cost-effective information for decision-makers.

title: Treasury Management Officer - Middle Market Banking - Life Sciences
description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  

﻿Are you customer focused, enjoy building relationships and providing financial solutions to your clients? You have found the right team.

As a Commercial Bank Treasury Management Officer in our Life Sciences Specialized Industry vertical, you will work closely with a growing team of bankers primarily on generating new Treasury Management business from current and prospective Life Sciences clients. You will be a member of the TS Sales team focused specifically on this vertical, so an understanding of and passion for Life Sciences as an industry is critical to your success and the success of the group. In this role you are a sales leader, and as such you will develop partnerships with Bankers, Client Service, Product Partners and Implementation teams in order bring the scale and value of the firm to your clients.

The Life Sciences Specialized Industry vertical within Middle Market Banking Specialized Industries is focused on the banking needs of biotech companies, pharmaceuticals, and medical device companies.

Job Responsibilities

Grow revenue by successfully prospecting and sourcing new treasury management business while retaining and expanding existing customer relationships.  Create strategic dialogues around key client-centric issues, incorporating best practices, industry benchmarking, opportunity quantification and solution positioning Collaborate with bankers and clients at senior and strategic levels to proactively provide integrated treasury solutions within a consultative and client driven framework Independently lead business process reviews aligned to key client sales opportunities and engage industry solutions specialist for complex client business process reviews Raise new solution ideas while partner with internal product stakeholders to represent the client perspective in the development and evolution of complex products and solutions  Deliver thought leadership to the market, prospects and clients on the working capital solutions at client roundtables, industry conferences, webinars, and professional media platforms. Manage the non-credit risk for customer portfolio and monitor and enhance profitability of all assigned relationships 

Required Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills

6+ years of cash management, sales and relationship management experience Success developing new business with focus on prospecting utilizing strong selling and negotiation skills Knowledge and understanding of Treasury Service products, credit and risk process, overdraft management discipline, and pricing philosophy Excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to develop strong working relationships with clients, colleagues, external centers of influence (COI), and external consulting organization Strong time management, organizational and planning skills Demonstrated experience of meeting or exceeding sales goals; proven top individual contributor 

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills

Bachelor’s degree Certified Treasury Professional designation Strong creative solution and problem-solving abilities

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Join Triumph!

At Triumph, a member of the Triumph Financial portfolio of brands, we believe the strength of our commitment is reflected in product innovation and the strategic partnerships we've established. That's why we look for team members who work hard to make a difference in their workplace and community. Our goal is to make long-term improvements in everything and everyone we touch. Create and manage repositories for reusable assets/artifacts. Create, maintain, and manage the required environments (Dev, QA, Prod) to ensure seamless cloud application development, integration, and service delivery.

The Cloud Engineer will also be responsible for creating and updating infrastructure documentation, systems assessments and reporting results. Participates in system design planning, review, and implementation to create enterprise solutions built on AWSProvides general and routine maintenance support including installation, patching, configuration, backups, and updatesRecommends modifications to systems to improve efficiency, reliability, and performance for delivering application and infrastructure in the cloudResponsible for participating in IT change management and asset management processesMaintains documented procedures for InfrastructureCollaborates with team members, developers, and software vendors to design, implement and test systems Requires occasionally working during non-business hours and on weekendsParticipates in on call rotationIs accountable on the use of services, handling of sensitive data, and resolving incidents and requests in compliance with FFIEC regulationsCreates and updates systems documentation, performing systems assessments, and reporting resultsContributes to research and evaluation and build out of new enterprise technologiesStays current with advances in technologiesPerforms other duties as assigned

title: Safety Manager
description:
Responsibilities 

The Safety Manager develops, monitors and implements Jefferson's health and safety policies; ensures compliance with all regulatory agencies; and is responsible for the reduction and prevention of safety hazards and accidents. This role ensures the health and safety of all Jefferson staff and personnel as well as patients, students and visitors.

Responsibilities

 Interacts with co-workers, visitors, and other staff consistent with the values of Jefferson  Responsible for the overall coordination and implementation of environmental health and safety policies and programs in compliance with The Joint Commission, DOH & CARF. Reviews and maintains all pertinent documentation for regulatory safety compliance. Responsible for ILSM & ICRA requirements as necessary.  Coordinates the Hazardous Waste program, overseeing, providing training and enforcing proper management of hazardous waste and employee safety  Identifies, evaluates and coordinates the correction of all workplace hazardous and safety conditions. Communicates safety issues to the Safety Committee and Administration.  Investigates and documents employee accidents and safety complaints, including theft. Collects, develops and maintains all accident and safety reports. Responsible for monthly, quarterly and annual reporting to hospital leadership.  Assists with Fire Safety, Life Safety and Emergency Management training, testing and inspections. Conducts Life Safety, Emergency Management and evacuation drills to ensure proper equipment function and safety staff preparedness.  Manages safety staff in all aspects of personnel management, including scheduling, payroll, providing regular performance feedback and delivering annual performance appraisals.  Manages or assists other campus safety related needs as they arise, including serving on the Emergency Response Team, partnering with Risk Management and/or Public Safety/Security, etc. 

 Qualifications 

Required knowledge, Skills and Abilities 

Knowledge of chemical toxicity, principles of chemical storage, use and disposal. Knowledge of the selection and use of Personal Protective Equipment. Knowledge of Life Safety, Environment of Care, Emergency Preparedness, IRCA & PICRA requirements.

Required Experience, Education, Certifications, Licenses

Minimum of five years’ experience in a healthcare institution, university, public or private organization specializing in safety. OSHA 40-hour HAZWOPER (within 90 days of hire). Bachelor of Science in environmental safety/protection, occupational safety, related discipline; work experience in healthcare safety may be substituted for the education requirement.

 Conditions of Employment 

Covid Vaccination is a requirement for employment at Jefferson for employees working at Jefferson’s clinical entities or at the University. If you are not currently vaccinated you will be required to receive the vaccination prior to hire date if you are offered employment, unless you request and receive an approved medical or religious exemption from Jefferson.

title: Scientist II - Translational Pharmacology
description:
SCIENTIST II – TRANSLATIONAL PHARMACOLOGY 
APTEVO THERAPEUTICS: Advancing the Science of Immuno-Oncology Aptevo Therapeutics is a biotech company focused on bringing novel immuno-oncology therapeutics to market. We leverage the innovative and proprietary ADAPTIR™ and ADAPTIR-FLEX™ platform technologies to create therapeutic candidates designed to improve outcomes for cancer patients.
JOB SUMMARY
This position in Translational Pharmacology includes biomarkers, pharmacokinetics, and immunogenicity. This role may focus on one or more of these areas while supporting and learning more about the others. This includes participating in planning the research, assay development, sample testing and data analysis for preclinical and clinical projects investigating novel, bispecific immunotherapy molecules in oncology. This position will design and conduct technically complex experiments in addition to identifying and introducing relevant emerging concepts in the field and more broadly, related fields. This involves performing advanced, experimental troubleshooting and methods development. This requires communicating theory, practice, and ideas for innovation to colleagues: written and oral, including leading scientific discussions. This role impacts the work of teams and project(s), including external collaborations. RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with research groups across multiple functions, including Protein Engineering, Immunobiology and Bioanalytical to support preclinical research programs.Support Clinical programs with method development, reagent management, sample testing and data analysis.Provide theoretical knowledge and practical experience in oncology, immunology, and pharmacology.After receiving general guidance on new assignments, work independently to research and plan work.Independently seek improvement of work practices and develop existing methods and protocols.Be able to lead the technical portion of projects, which may include identifying challenges and exploring solutions, including reviews of scientific literature. Write and review technical documents. Deliver new ideas that have an impact on Aptevo’s scientific objectives.Acquire new theoretical knowledge and techniques as needed to meet company goals and project milestones. Demonstrate technical skills and creativity. Independently design, execute, analyze, and interpret complex experiments with solid scientific judgement, and communicate relevant data. Contribute technical information for reports, publications, and presentations, as needed. Assist with clinical sample receipt, storage, and analysis according to study protocols and test methods with a high level of precision and documentation. Draft presentations of data for review.Translate complex ideas clearly outside of the team to general audiences and present confidently.May supervise the day-to-day work of more junior (and/or new) team members and contribute to the professional development of others; may mentor associate scientists on job duties and general departmental operations.Work closely with manager and other colleagues on how to deliver results and build Aptevo's scientific capabilities.Other duties as assigned.
EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS Requires PhD or equivalent and 2+ years’ experience; or MS/MA and 10+ years of experience, or BS/BA and 12+ years of experience.Experience with biomarker discovery and development is preferred.Knowledge and experience in immunology, oncology, molecular and cellular biology are preferred.Ability to plan and balance multiple experiments and projects, and work independently.Ability to analyze results and perform independent experimentation related to Translational Pharmacology (PK, biomarkers, immunogenicity).Experience with methods to determine titer and binding characteristics of molecules, and support development of assays, such as PK and immunogenicity.Experience evaluating experimental results and exercising analytical thought and scientific judgment to solve problems.Strong ability to communicate experimental procedures and results through a variety of group, project, or department team meetings, as well as in report format. Excellent organizational skills, including accurate, detailed records.Excellent data analysis skills, including familiarity with software such as GraphPad Prism and JMP.Familiarity with Good Laboratory Practices is a plus.Experience with clinical sample management, including reconciliation and communication with CROs and clinical sites is a plus.Familiarity with non-clinical safety (toxicology) study planning and data review is a plus.Proficient use of MS/office and other standard computer programs is necessary.Equivalent education/experience may substitute for stated requirements. SALARY RANGE: $107,564 - 150,074
EMPLOYEE BENEFITS (for Regular, non-Temporary/non-Contract Employees)
Generous paid time off (PTO) program9 paid holidays + paid time off between Christmas and New Year’s DayMedical, dental insurance for employees and eligible dependent(s) – PPO & High Deductible PlanVision planHealth Savings Account (HSA) with employer funding: single: $500, family: $1,000Flexible Spending Account (FSA)Health Care Flexible Spending AccountDependent Care Flexible Spending AccountEquity award eligibilityAnnual bonus plan eligibility401(k) Plan: $.50 match for every dollar contributed to a maximum of 3%Roth plan enrollmentBasic life and AD&D insurance: company paidLong-term disability: company paidShort-term disability: company paidSupplemental Life and AD&D for employee, spouse and child(ren)Employee Referral BonusEmployee Assistance Plan (EAP)Paid parental leaveTuition reimbursement program

title: Sanitation Technician
description:
Who Kerry Is

Kerry is the world's leading taste and nutrition company for the food, beverage and pharmaceutical industries. Every day we partner with customers to create healthier, tastier and more sustainable products that are consumed by billions of people across the world. Our vision is to be our customers' most valued partner, creating a world of sustainable nutrition. A career with Kerry offers you an opportunity to shape the future of food while providing you opportunities to explore and grow in a truly global environment.

Where You'll Work

With over 45 plants across North America, the Owatonna, MN, USA plant is a part of our Beverage division that mass blends savory food ingredients. These dry blended ingredients improve taste and solubility to products like K-Cups, probiotics drinks, vinegar and blended rice’s which are packaged by our customers. We are hiring career minded people to help meet growing demands for quality ingredients! You'll have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment with people who care about what we do! If you’re looking for a manufacturing facility where you can build a career and have fun while you do it, we might be the team for you!

What You'll Do

The  Production Sanitation position is responsible for janitorial tasks that are part of the Sanitation Program. Supporting the production team with industrial sanitation needs, maintaining supply levels, cleaning drains, following GMP and required protocols. Additional duties include cleaning of common areas such as lunchroom, rest rooms, offices and trash pick-up and removal. This position reports to the Sanitation Supervisor. In the absence of the Industrial Sanitation employee, another Industrial Sanitation employee will serve as backup. We offer multiple career paths, training in GMP, HACCP, food safety and food production related subjects.

 Day Shift, 6:00 AM - 4:30 PM, Monday - Thursday, Overtime on Fridays Available * 

Qualifications And Skills

 High School graduate or equivalent required.  Basic math skills, ability to calculate percentages.  1 yr. Manufacturing experience, preferably in a chemical or food processing facility.  Knowledge of GMP's, food manufacturing sanitation requirements  Use of RF scanners, inventory tracking and control systems  Prior lift truck operation and safety certification.  Use of MS products required, SAP software preferred.  Capable of lifting up to 50 lbs.  Able to work unsupervised, as well as working together with others  Good organizational and mathematical skills  Knowledge of food manufacturing sanitation requirements.  Ability and willingness to follow, plant Quality, Safety and Security policies and guidelines.  Ability to effectively communicate with co-workers and plant leaders.

title: Sr. Software Engineer, Application Support
description:
Senior Software Engineer, Application Support

American Public Education, Inc. 

The Senior, Software Engineer, Application Support provides and advances application support, administration, and availability management of the APEI application portfolio. She/he may lead coordination of Information Technology (IT) and business user resources for prompt escalation, recovery, and resolutions of applications/systems incidents/defect/bugs/data issues across a dynamic 24x7 enterprise. This position analyzes and supports application issues, enhancements, and service requirements that process business workflows, procedures, administration, and automation improvements to existing and new application/systems. The Senior, Software Engineer, Application Support will be self-motivated, and adept in performing software engineering responsibilities within a deadline and fast-paced environment. She/he will maintain the health of our application/platform production systems, reactively and proactively, as well as managing multiple priorities with stakeholders to deliver business continuity and support.

This position reports to the Manager, Software Engineering, Application Support. The Senior, Software Engineer, Application Support has no direct or indirect reports.

Responsibilities:

 Experience with leading application support activities to troubleshoot, administer, and resolve complex application/system issues to meet business priorities.  Confers key business users involved to analyze current operational procedures, identify problems, and learn specific input and output requirements including forms of data input, methods to summarize data, and formats for reports.Assists with functional & technical specifications and Quality Assurance as needed to support Software Engineering Domains, such as CMS, ERP, SIS, LMS, Integration, etc. Reviews application/platform capabilities, workflow, and scheduling limitations to support requested change/modification. Studies existing business processes of application/platform(s) to evaluate effectiveness and makes suggestions to improve production workflow as required. Prepares and enhances workflow, diagrams, support documentation to specify standard operating procedures to be performed. Participate in validating the application changes, upgrade, and other infrastructure changes to production environment.Submits requests and assists with upgrades and improvements for application/system performance.Assists Software Engineers in resolution of incidents/problems related to application/systems.
